intro: Lagenocarpus tremulus, commonly known as the trembling pod, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, hairy stems and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, elongated pods that hang from the stems, giving it its common name. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in tropical botany.
